title: NBA free agency winners and losers: Early results are in
content: From big-man depth to the New Orleans Pelicans, here are the early winners and losers of free agency.

title: Hammon slams Aces' 'trash' effort in 27-point loss
content: The Aces shot 26.2% and were routed 81-54 by the Fever, causing coach Becky Hammon to call it "one of the worst games I've ever seen."

title: Boxer Ch√°vez Jr. arrested by ICE, to be deported
content: The family of Mexican boxer Julio C√©sar Ch√°vez Jr. says it has "full confidence in his innocence" after he was arrested by U.S. immigration officers and set to be deported to Mexico.

title: Trump wants UFC fight on White House grounds
content: President Donald Trump says he is thinking of staging a UFC match on the White House grounds with upward of 20,000 spectators to celebrate 250 years of American independence.

title: 2 allegedly stole $2M+ from ex-Dolphins safety
content: A woman is in jail after she and a former financial adviser were accused of stealing millions of dollars from former Dolphins safety Reshad Jones.

title: Lynx's Reeve, Liberty's Brondello to coach ASG
content: Cheryl Reeve of the Minnesota Lynx and Sandy Brondello of the New York Liberty were tapped on Thursday as the head coaches for the upcoming WNBA All-Star Game.

title: Sources: Lakers to re-sign Hayes on 1-year deal
content: Free agent center Jaxson Hayes agreed on a one-year deal to return to the Los Angeles Lakers, sources told ESPN.

title: Chelsea: Grieving Neto to decide CWC availability
content: Chelsea coach Enzo Maresca said Pedro Neto is grieving the death of his close friend and Portugal teammate Diogo Jota, and the decision to play in Friday's Club World Cup quarterfinal against Palmeiras is his own.

title: Dodgers' Muncy relieved MRI clean, out 6 weeks
content: Los Angeles Dodgers third baseman Max Muncy went on the injured list Thursday because of a left knee bone bruise.

title: üèà Who's the best No. 1 NFL draft pick ever?
content: We went through every NFL draft since 1967 and named the best selection at every slot, from Peyton Manning at No. 1 to Brock Purdy at No. 262.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Four top-10 teams debut at highest rankings of 2025
content: While the Astros continue their ascent, the Rays and Blue Jays are threatening the Yankees in the AL East.

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: 'Once I saw A'ja do it, I did it': How Wilson's leg sleeve inspired a new generation
content: The three-time MVP's practical solution to keeping her legs balanced has taken hold across the sports world.

title: Remembering Diogo Jota, a star whose loss is felt beyond Liverpool
content: The death of Liverpool forward Diogo Jota has caused an outpouring of grief from those associated with the Reds and far beyond. As Jurgen Klopp put it, "there must be a bigger purpose, but I can't see it."

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 21 five-stars in the Class of '26. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: Is this Djokovic's last chance to win a final Grand Slam?
content: Wimbledon is likely Djokovic's greatest opportunity to win a record 25th Grand Slam. Can he possibly do it?

title: Sleepers, busts and breakouts for 2025
content: Which players will surprise, disappoint or make a big jump this fantasy season? Our analysts give their picks.

title: Aces to Dodgers and Cubs? A star closer for Phillies? One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: The deadline is a month away. Could players such as Eugenio Suarez and Emmanuel Clase finish the season on a different team?

title: Diego Luna, USMNT's Gold Cup hero, is ready to take on Mexico in final
content: Diego Luna has soared up the USMNT depth chart thanks to several big goals during the Gold Cup. Yet the Mexican-American playmaker is taking it all in stride and is excited for his first encounter with El Tri in Sunday's final.

title: Liverpool forward Diogo Jota dies in car crash
content: Liverpool and Portugal forward Diogo Jota and his brother, Andr√© Silva, were killed in a car crash near Zamora, Spain, police said Thursday.

title: CWC 'difficult' for Cancelo, Neves with Jota's death
content: Al Hilal coach Simone Inzaghi has admitted R√∫ben Neves and Jo√£o Cancelo have found it "difficult" to prepare for the FIFA Club World Cup quarterfinal against Fluminense following the death of their international teammate Diogo Jota.

title: Slot, Ronaldo lead tributes to Liverpool star Jota
content: Tributes have been paid to Liverpool forward Diogo Jota after the Portugal international and his brother, Andr√© Silva, died in a car crash in Spain.

title: Est√™v√£o told to defeat Chelsea -- then join them
content: Palmeiras manager Abel Ferreira has told teenage winger Est√™v√£o to showcase his talent against future employers Chelsea in the Club World Cup quarterfinals on Friday.

title: Dortmund announce Jamie Gittens exit for Chelsea
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal to sign English winger Jamie Gittens from Borussia Dortmund, the Bundesliga club said on Thursday.

title: Ex-Arsenal star Ramsey joins Liga MX side Pumas
content: Former Arsenal and Juventus midfielder Aaron Ramsey has signed with Liga MX giants Pumas, the Mexican club announced.

title: Pogba on France return: Still at 'stage one'
content: Paul Pogba has said that he hopes to make a return to the French national team but added that there are "stages" to the process, as he was presented by Monaco on Thursday.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Portugal honor Jota in Spain rout; Italy win
content: An emotional Portugal side took on Spain, while Italy beat Belgium. Here's what you need to know from Thursday's Euro 2025 action.

title: Meet the 2026 recruits who remind us of some big NBA players
content: Projecting high school talent isn't an exact science, but it's easier when they remind us of NBA stars at that age.

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: B-2 Mystery After Iran Strikes: Where Is The US Stealth Bomber
content: A US Air Force bombing operation targeting Iran's nuclear facilities has taken an unexpected turn. One group of the B-2 Spirit stealth bombers involved has reportedly not returned to base, raising questions about its whereabouts.

title: Video: "Awkward To Make Him Wait, Could Get Offended" - Putin On Trump Call
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin while attending an event sprung a surprise by announcing he would speak to his American counterpart Donald Trump in a few minutes.

title: Car Driven By Drunk Man With Fractured Hand Hits Bikes, Cycle: 2 Killed
content: Two persons were killed and three others injured when a car driven by a man allegedly under the influence of alcohol hit three bikes and a cycle in Chhattisgarh's Korba city, an official said on Friday.

title: Trump To Sign "Big, Beautiful Bill" During US Independence Day Celebration
content: US President Donald Trump will sign his flagship tax and spending bill Friday in a pomp-laden Independence Day ceremony featuring fireworks and a flypast by the type of stealth bomber that bombed Iran.

title: Actor Vijay Is TVK's Official Chief Minister Candidate, Won't Ally With BJP
content: Actor-politician Vijay has been announced as the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam's (TVK) official chief ministerial candidate for the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly elections.

title: "Maid's Family Earns Rs 1.3 Lakh Per Month, Tax Free": Reddit Post Goes Viral
content: A Reddit post comparing the collective earnings of a family of a domestic help with that of a tax-paying salaried individual has received massive criticism on the platform.

title: China Says US Lifted Some Export Curbs, Warns Against 'Blackmail'
content: China said Friday that the United States has eased certain export restrictions in line with a "hard-won" framework reached at talks last month, warning against "blackmail and coercion" as the countries attempt to de-escalate a ruinous trade war.

title: Expect Hamas Decision In 24 Hours On 'Final' Peace Proposal: Trump
content: US President Donald Trump said on Friday it would probably be known in 24 hours whether the Palestinian militant group Hamas has agreed to accept what he has called a "final proposal" for an Israel-Hamas ceasefire in Gaza.

title: Blistering Heat, Empty Chairs, C-Word Hit UN's Flagship Development Event
content: Brutal heat scorched Spain this week, a blistering reminder of the climate change that is battering the poorest countries - stretching their finances even as government debt climbs to new heights. Two aspects were less abundant: money and power.

title: BJP Leader Jagannath Pradhan Arrested Over Assault On Officer In Odisha
content: BJP leader Jagannath Pradhan has been arrested over the assault on an on-duty Odisha Administrative Service (OAS) officer.

title: As Trade Tensions Rise, A Look At How Trump Has Roiled Financial Markets
content: With sweeping tariffs on friend and foe, US President Donald Trump has roiled financial markets and sparked a surge in economic uncertainty -- and tensions are mounting days before a fresh volley of higher duties are due to kick in.

title: Probe Agency Conducts Raids In Money Laundering Case Against Jharkhand Ex-Minister
content: The ED on Friday raided multiple locations in Jharkhand as part of an ongoing alleged illegal sand mining and extortion linked money laundering investigation against former minister Yogendra Sao and his family members, official sources said.

title: Jailed Tillu Gang Member To Marry During 5-Hour Parole In Delhi Today
content: Gangster Amit alias Dabang, a key member of the Tillu Tajpuriya gang who is lodged in Tihar Jail, will be out on a five-hour parole for his wedding on Friday.

title: GOP Tax Package Gives NASA Billions After Donald Trump Proposed Cuts
content: The reconciliation package includes $4.1 billion for NASA's Boeing Co.-built Space Launch System, or SLS, rocket and $20 million directed to the Lockheed Martin Corp.

title: Captain 'Shux', Halfway Through His Space Journey, Has Travelled 5 Million km
content: After week in space, Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla finally got some down time and he managed to have a chat with his family in Lucknow and also held an interaction with students at his alma mater the City Montessori School.

title: Video: Truck Drags Car For 1 Km On UP Highway, 2 Dead
content: At least two people were killed and three others injured after a car they were travelling in was dragged by a truck on a highway in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur.

title: Man Walks Into Hospital To Treat Infection, Doctor Removes His Genitals
content: The genitals of a 28-year-old man were allegedly removed in a hospital in Assam's Cachar district by the doctor during his biopsy test, without the patient's consent.

title: Supreme Court Junks HDFC Bank CEO's Plea Challenging Case By Lilavati Trust
content: The Supreme Court on Friday refused to entertain the plea of HDFC Bank CEO and MD Sashidhar Jagdishan seeking quashing of FIR lodged against him for cheating and fraud by Lilavati Kirtilal Mehta Medical Trust, as Bombay High Court is hearing plea.

title: "Desh Secular Nahi Hai": NDTV Confronts Vigilante Over Kanwar Yatra Crackdown
content: Members of a Hindu group who asked a Muslim man to remove his pants to check his identity have doubled down on their act.

title: "Mai Mar Hi Jaata Hu": Criminal Threatens To Jump Off 5th Floor During Raid
content: Abhishek, alias Sanjaysinh Tomar or Shooter, wanted in multiple cases, also said that an officer had threatened him that he would "rip out his nails".

title: Introducing the 'Bag' Hall of Fame: Eight NFL stars who got PAID, over and over and over again
content: Which players have negotiated the most profitable contracts over their careers? Bill Barnwell gives his picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid open to Rodrygo exit; Arsenal keen
content: Real Madrid are open to letting forward Rodrygo leave, with Arsenal ready to swoop. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Defiant Verstappen guarded over Mercedes speculation
content: Max Verstappen again refused to be drawn on ongoing speculation he might leave Red Bull for Mercedes in 2026.

title: What to know ahead of the British Grand Prix at Silverstone
content: Seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton is the most successful driver at the British GP with nine wins,

title: Ranking the fights: Usyk-Dubois 2, Taylor-Serrano 3, Pacquiao's return and more
content: From Oleksandr Usyk, a women's trilogy fight and Manny Pacquiao's return, ESPN picks July's best fights.

title: Profar comes back strong? Crawford leads league in steals? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Risers and Fallers: Ionescu struggling, Canada returning to form
content: Sabrina Ionescu's recent shooting struggles and Jordin Canada's production highlight the top risers and fallers in fantasy this week.

title: Blackmail, fake parcel: How 'delivery agent' drugged, raped Pune techie in her flat
content: In Kondhwa, Pune, a 22-year-old data scientist was allegedly raped in her apartment by a man posing as a courier delivery agent. The assailant sprayed a chemical on her face, took a selfie with her, and threatened to upload it if she reported the crime.

title: Big revelation on Op Sindoor: 'China fed Pak live data on India assets, Turkey sent trained staff'
content: Lieutenant General Rahul R Singh revealed that China provided Pakistan with real-time intelligence during India's 'Operation Sindoor.' He highlighted that Pakistan may target Indian population centers in future conflicts, emphasizing the need for a robust air defense system.

title: Watch: Massive fireball erupts in Rome fuel depot; over 20 injured
content: A massive explosion at a Rome fuel station injured 20, including eight police officers responding to the scene. Initial reports suggest a truck crashed into a pipeline, triggering the blast and subsequent fires. The incident, marked by a large fireball and thick smoke, prompted evacuations of nearby buildings, including a children's camp.

title: '6 balls, 6 actions': Ishan Kishan imitates Dhoni, Harbhajan, Warne in 1 over
content: Ishan Kishan last played a Test for India during the tour of the West Indies in July 2023. While his IPL 2025 season with Sunrisers Hyderabad was modest ‚Äî 354 runs in 14 games ‚Äî his recent red-ball form in England has been far more compelling. On Wednesday, in an unexpected turn, he was handed the ball and made full use of the opportunity.

title: Tesla CEO reiterates push to deorbit ISS: Shares post on Twitter; says ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs time to retire‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Elon Musk has once again advocated for the deorbiting of the International Space Station (ISS), suggesting a shift in focus towards Mars missions. Citing the ISS's diminishing utility and the high costs of extending its lifespan, Musk proposes redirecting resources to private ventures and Mars exploration.

title: Dalai Lama successor: Tibet's prez-in-exile picks apart China's 'Golden Urn' tradition
content: The Central Tibetan Administration (CTA) president, Penpa Tsering, challenged China's claim over the Dalai Lama's succession, questioning Beijing's interference in Tibetan religious freedom. This response follows China's insistence on the 'Golden Urn' process, which Tsering argues is a relatively recent imposition.

title: DSP Siraj breathes fire! Sends Stokes for a duck, leaves Root fuming - WATCH
content: Mohammed Siraj's fiery spell on Day 3 of the Edgbaston Test has put India in a commanding position. He dismissed Joe Root and then Ben Stokes for a golden duck in consecutive deliveries. Root edged a flick to Pant, while Stokes was undone by a sharp bouncer. India aims to level the series after England's initial victory.

title: 'Is ECI God?': Pappu Yadav's 'do-or-die' call as Bihar roll revision row flares
content: Pappu Yadav, a Congress-leaning MP, has declared a "do-or-die battle" against the Election Commission's electoral roll revision in Bihar, labeling the ECI as an "office of the RSS." Congress has also criticized the revision as a "sinister exercise" to disenfranchise voters. Despite opposition protests, parties like RJD, Congress, and others have deployed thousands of BLAs for the revision process.

title: Nvidia sets new record: Surpasses Apple & Microsoft
content: Nvidia's market value soared to $3.92 trillion on Thursday, potentially making it the most valuable company ever, driven by Wall Street's AI optimism. Surpassing Apple's previous record, Nvidia's specialized chips are crucial for training large AI models, fueling immense demand. Its market capitalization exceeds the combined value of all publicly listed companies in Canada, Mexico, and even the United Kingdom.

title: Krishna Janmabhoomi row: Allahabad HC says Shahi Eidgah ‚Äònot disputed‚Äô; plea dismissed
content: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed a plea by the Shahi Jama Masjid committee, challenging a survey of the Shahi Idgah mosque in Sambhal. Hindus claim the mosque was built over a demolished temple.

title: Caught on cam: Man sets relative's house on fire over financial dispute
content: In Bengaluru's Vivek Nagar, Subramani allegedly set fire to his relative Sathish Kumar's house over a financial dispute. The incident, occurring on July 1st, caused damage to the property, though no injuries were reported. The conflict stemmed from a loan taken years ago by Parvati from Venkataramani.

title: Leave India...: Foxconn to Chinese staff at Indian iPhone factories; What's Beijing's role
content: Apple's iPhone production faces disruption as Foxconn experiences a significant withdrawal of Chinese engineers from its Indian facilities, impacting the ramp-up for iPhone 17 manufacturing. This exodus, influenced by China's efforts to restrict technology transfer and skilled labor exports, threatens Apple's ambitious goals to shift iPhone production to India amidst rising geopolitical tensions and supply chain diversification efforts.

title: Delhi double murder: Boy walked into scene of mother's murder, tried to hide in bathroom
content: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar, Mukesh Paswan, a garment worker, murdered his employer's wife and teenage son. The gruesome crime occurred after a dispute over a Rs 45,000 advance and Paswan's absenteeism. He was arrested in UP while attempting to flee.

title: CUET UG 2025 scorecards released at examinationservices.nic.in, check direct link here
content: The CUET UG 2025 result has been officially declared by the National Testing Agency. Over 13 lakh candidates can now check their scorecards on cuet.nta.nic.in or through the direct result link. The scores will be used for admissions across 243 universities, including DU, BHU, JNU, and AMU. This year‚Äôs results are based on normalised percentiles, and include postponed papers such as Tamil, Urdu, and accountancy. Counselling and admission processes will begin shortly.

title: Lauren Kyle Builds Own Legacy: Connor McDavid's wife makes mark in design and fashion
content: Lauren Kyle McDavid is emerging as a prominent figure in Edmonton's design and fashion scene, establishing her own identity beyond her husband's hockey fame. She launched Trove Living, a high-end furniture showroom and design firm, and founded Sports Club Atelier, a sportswear label. With McDavid's support, Kyle's entrepreneurial spirit is transforming Edmonton's creative landscape, marking her as a rising force.

title: Aaron Rodgers blasts ‚Äòsick society‚Äô: Plans private life after last season
content: Aaron Rodgers plans to disappear from the spotlight after his final NFL season with the Pittsburgh Steelers. He confirmed his one-year deal and desire to leave public life completely with his wife, Brittani. Rodgers defends Brittani's privacy and criticizes paparazzi intrusion. He won't sell wedding photos or leak family information.

title: NRL reporter pushed out: Tiffany Salmond says networks sidelined her
content: Tiffany Salmond, a prominent New Zealand footy presenter, alleges she was pushed out of NRL broadcasts due to being perceived as "too bold" by TV executives. Salmond claims major networks made a collective decision to sideline her, leading to a lack of work opportunities. She advocates for rethinking the treatment of outspoken female reporters in the media industry.

title: Watch: Russian boxer gives e-cigarette to orangutan; video sparks outrage
content: Russian boxer Anastasia Luchkina is under fire after a video surfaced showing her giving an e-cigarette to Dana, an orangutan at a Crimean safari park. The endangered orangutan has since exhibited disturbing behavior, including loss of appetite and lethargy. Veterinarians are examining Dana, fearing she may have ingested the nicotine cartridge, while the incident has sparked widespread outrage and condemnation.

title: 'Drag India forward like Kohli': Vaughan's challenge to Gill, Jaiswal, Pant
content: Michael Vaughan believes Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Rishabh Pant must collectively fill the void left by Virat Kohli's departure from Test cricket. Vaughan acknowledged their potential but emphasised the need to replicate Kohli's intensity and global dominance to maintain India's competitive edge. He cautioned against underestimating the impact of losing Kohli and Rohit Sharma.

title: Himachal rain crisis: 69 dead, many missing; rescue ops on
content: Torrential rains and cloudbursts in Himachal Pradesh have claimed at least 69 lives and caused over Rs 400 crore in damages since June 20. Mandi district is the worst-hit, with homes collapsing and vehicles being swept away. Rescue operations are underway as the IMD forecasts continued heavy rainfall and potential landslides.

title: Trent share price today: Stock drops around 9%; Nuvama downgrades
content: Trent Ltd.'s shares plummeted 8.7% after its AGM revealed a projected revenue growth slowdown to 20% for Q1FY26, significantly lower than the previous 35% CAGR. Nuvama brokerage downgraded the stock to 'hold,' reducing the target price due to concerns about moderating growth and high valuations.

title: Aastha Poonia becomes 1st woman to be trained as fighter pilot
content: Slt Aastha Poonia made history as the first woman to be trained as a fighter pilot in the Indian Navy. She and Lt Atul Kumar Dhull were awarded the 'Wings of Gold' at @IN_Dega. This achievement marks a significant step towards gender inclusivity in Naval Aviation, promoting equality and opportunity within the Indian Navy.

title: Drunk teacher dances with schoolgirls in classroom; suspended after viral video
content: A shocking video surfaced from Pashupatipur Primary School in Wadrafnagar, showing headmaster Laxmi Narayan Singh intoxicated and dancing inappropriately with girl students. This misconduct, along with allegations of frequent inebriation and unwarranted physical punishment, prompted swift action. Balrampur District Education Officer D N Mishra suspended Singh, and local MLA Shakuntala Porte demanded strict disciplinary measures.

title: Tamil Nadu 2026 polls: TVK names actor Vijay CM candidate; can he take on MK Stalin?
content: Vijay, the Tamil film star, has been announced as the chief ministerial candidate for his party, Tamizhaga Vetri Kazhagam (TVK), in the 2026 Tamil Nadu assembly elections. TVK, launched in February 2024, aims to bring fundamental political change. Vijay plans a state-wide tour from September to December to strengthen the party's base.

title: Chess | 'No time for noise': Vidit Gujrathi hits out at 'LiverDoc' for insulting doctor parents, family
content: Grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi defended his family members' professions after a social media user questioned their legitimacy as doctors on National Doctors' Day. The dispute arose when Gujrathi acknowledged his father, an ayurvedic specialist, mother, a cosmetologist, sister, a physiotherapist, and wife, a homeopathic doctor.

title: ‚ÄòProud mom moment‚Äô: Hillary Trocheck reacts as Will Cuylle renews contract with NHL team
content: When rookie Will Cuylle faced living in a hotel, Vincent Trocheck, remembering his own challenging start, offered him a home with his family in Harrison, New York. Cuylle quickly became part of the Trocheck family, celebrated by Vincent's wife, Hillary, who proudly calls him her son. Recently, Cuylle signed a two-year, $7.

title: India to spend Rs 1L crore for spy planes, naval gear; China-Pak axis stirs urgency
content: Defence ministry has approved acquisition projects worth over Rs 1 lakh crore. The approvals include indigenous construction of mine countermeasure vessels, procurement of quick-reaction surface-to-air missile systems, and intelligence, surveillance, target acquisition & reconnaissance planes. Other projects include semi-submersible autonomous vessels, armored recovery vehicles, and electronic warfare systems to boost India's defense capabilities.

title: 'Till lion learns to write...': Radhika Gupta slams Prada amid sandals row; what she said
content: Prada faces online criticism for sandals resembling Indian Kolhapuri chappals without acknowledging the artisans. Edelweiss MF CEO Radhika Gupta emphasized the importance of crediting original creators and preserving India's textile heritage. Following backlash, Prada will meet with MACCIA on July 11 to discuss potential collaboration, including co-branded collections and skill development, aiming to recognize and benefit Kolhapuri artisans.

title: Bharat Mobility Expo‚Äôs next edition announced: And it‚Äôs not next year! Details
content: The Bharat Mobility Global Expo is gearing up for its 2027 edition. The event will take place in Delhi NCR. It is scheduled from February 4 to 9. The expo will showcase automotive, logistics, and technology advancements. New segments will include multimodal, urban, and rural mobility. Tractors and agricultural solutions will also be highlighted.

title: Language row: Maha minister asks why 'Javed, Aamir' spared for not speaking Marathi
content: Following the assault of a shopkeeper in Mira Road for not speaking Marathi, Maharashtra minister Nitesh Rane urged, "show courage, go to Null Bazaar, Mohammed Ali Road and tell people there to speak Marathi." The incident occurred after an argument over language, with the shopkeeper claiming he was slapped for stating that many languages are spoken in Maharashtra.

title: Jane Street ban: Why has SEBI barred US-based trading firm? Explained
content: India's SEBI has accused Jane Street of market manipulation, alleging the firm artificially inflated stock prices to benefit from options trading, generating substantial profits. The regulator has frozen Rs 4,844 crore and imposed a market ban on the global trading giant. Jane Street has the option to appeal the decision.

title: Secret wedding? New twist in honeymoon case; cops find second 'mangalsutra'
content: The brother of murdered Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi suspects Raja‚Äôs wife, Sonam, the prime suspect, may have secretly married her accomplice while in hiding after the honeymoon murder in Meghalaya. He criticized Sonam‚Äôs brother for expressing a desire to meet her after initially seeking forgiveness from the deceased's family.

title: 'Could get offended': Putin rushes out mid-event to take Trump's call - watch
content: Vladimir Putin paused a major event to take a call from Donald Trump, fearing offense at being kept waiting. The leaders engaged in a lengthy discussion covering topics such as Ukraine and Iran, though Trump expressed disappointment at the lack of progress on a Ukraine peace deal.

title: US-Iran deal on cards? Trump meets Saudi def min, Tehran in focus
content: President Trump met with Saudi Arabia's defense minister to discuss de-escalation with Iran and broader Middle East peace efforts, including ending the Gaza conflict and hostage release negotiations. The administration aims to expand the Abraham Accords, with potential new countries joining soon. These discussions occur amid heightened tensions following recent military operations and ongoing efforts to restart nuclear talks.

title: 'Bihar ki beti': PM Modi hails Indian roots of Trinidad & Tobago PM
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Trinidad and Tobago, marking the first bilateral visit by an Indian Prime Minister since 1999. He addressed the Indian community, acknowledging their contributions and strong ties to India. Modi referred to Prime Minister Kamla Persad-Bissessar as "Bihar ki Beti," highlighting her ancestral roots and the cultural connection between the two nations.

title: Ex-BJP functionary hacked to death in TN; manhunt launched
content: In Dindigul, Balakrishnan, a former BJP member, was murdered. The incident occurred near Madur Junction. A gang attacked him with billhooks. Balakrishnan died at the scene. Police suspect a monetary dispute as the motive. Sanarpatti police are investigating the case. They are searching for the suspects involved in the crime. The event happened on Thursday evening.

title: IND vs ENG: Insatiable Shubman Gill shows why he's undisputed leader of lineup
content: Shubman Gill is proving his mettle as India's new Test captain, silencing doubts with a remarkable performance in England. His dedication and hunger for runs were evident in his extensive training sessions. Gill's leadership extends beyond his own batting, as he actively supports the young batting group, fostering a confident and positive mindset within the team.

title: Sanjay Raut takes 'vikas purush' jibe at PM Modi over Varanasi roads
content: Sanjay Raut, Shiv Sena (UBT) leader, criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi regarding the deteriorating road conditions in Varanasi, his parliamentary constituency. Raut highlighted viral social media images of collapsed roads and difficulties faced by pilgrims.

title: 'Biggest bill ever signed': How 'beautiful' is Trump's mega bill - and for whom
content: House Republicans passed the 'ONE BIG BEAUTIFUL BILL,' securing President Trump's signature on July 4. The legislation makes permanent $4.5 trillion in tax cuts, introduces new tax breaks, and enacts $1.2 trillion in spending cuts targeting Medicaid and food stamps. It also allocates $350 billion for border security and raises the national debt ceiling by $5 trillion.

title: UFC fight at White House? How Trump wants to mark America's 250th I-Day
content: Donald Trump is considering hosting a UFC match on the White House grounds as part of the America 250 celebrations. The president announced this plan during a speech at the Iowa State Fairgrounds, mentioning his friendship with UFC CEO Dana White.

title: ‚ÄòIt was always yours‚Äô: Kaanta Laga makers speak up after Shefali Jariwala‚Äôs death
content: Shefali Jariwala, famed for 'Kaanta Laga', passed away at 42 due to cardiac arrest. Directors Radhika Rao and Vinay Sapru paid tribute. They confirmed 'Kaanta Laga' would never have a sequel. The directors shared memories of discovering Shefali. Her last rites were performed. The industry mourned the loss of the iconic 'Kaanta Laga' girl. Her contribution will always be remembered.

title: IND vs ENG: 'I missed my 300' - Shubman Gill gets emotional after parents' message
content: Shubman Gill's record-breaking 269 against England at Edgbaston was followed by an emotional moment as he received a congratulatory message from his parents. The BCCI captured Gill's post-match routine, including recovery, media duties, and a warm welcome at the hotel. Gill acknowledged the importance of his father's guidance in his cricketing journey, while also humorously lamenting missing his triple century.

title: Luna eclipse: No stars, no problem as USMNT finds new focal point
content: the united states defeated Guatemala 2-1 to advance to the final of the Concacaf gold cup . the men's national team beat the country 2-1 in the semifinal . a brace from Diego Luna put the U.S. up 1-0 early on .

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: A new world in Big Apple baseball: Steve Cohen, Hal Steinbrenner and the battle for NYC supremacy
content: the Rays and blue Jays are closing in on the Yankees in the AL East race . the rivalry between the two franchises has reached a point that those who have lived the rivalries were skeptical they'd ever see . "the Mets have kind of turned the corner from being that little cousin or little brother or sister," says showalter . they have followed parallel paths so far this season .

title: Kershaw joins the 3K club! Where does he rank among pitchers with 3,000 strikeouts?
content: the 3,000-strikeout club has grown by one, with Clayton Kershaw becoming the 20th pitcher in baseball history to reach that milestone . the 3K pitching club doesn't generate as much hullabaloo as its hitting counterpart, but it is more exclusive: Thirty-three players have reached 3,000 hits .

title: Ranking the best available free agents after the initial rush
content: new contracts have come at a fast and furious pace during the opening hours of free agency . 18 of my top 25 potential free agents had already found landing spots . there are players available who could make a difference next season and beyond .

title: Which clubs are the best transfer fit for Europe's top strikers?
content: arsenal have had the 22-year-old on their radar for some time . but the drawn-out nature of negotiations over a potential ‚Ç¨70 million move raises some questions . he offers both a target to play the ball in to and a threat in behind the defense .

title: Madden NFL 26 features a fully reworked Superstar mode
content: superstar mode is celebrating its 20th anniversary in Madden NFL 26 . the integration with College Football's Road to Glory mode returns as well . players will get realistic opportunities on the field to replace an injured player or wrap up a dominant victory from time to time .

title: Top 50 trade deadline candidates -- and their best landing spots
content: Xavier Scruggs names the players he believes could be up for grabs at the trade deadline . some of the players on the list are unlikely to be dealt but at least are being discussed in potential deals . players are ranked by value for their new team, not likelihood of being dealt .

title: ‚ÄòBig Beautiful‚Äô speech: This Democrat spoke for over 8 hrs; GOP passed bill right after
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: India‚Äôs ‚ÄòTrump Card‚Äô on trade deal? How India can handle US pressure and seal agreement
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce and can navigate the complexities of the business world .

title: BJP ignores its 11-year authoritarian rule but remembers Emergency: AICC president Kharge
content: Upcoming changes will throw up lots of political opportunities: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy tells Congress cadre

title: National Herald case: ED case very strange, Sonia Gandhi argues in court
content: The ED has accused Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, late Congress leaders Motilal Vora and Oscar Fernandes aside from Suman Dubey, Sam Pitroda and a private company Young Indian of conspiracy and money laundering

title: Operation Sindoor was ‚Äòfinest example‚Äô of commitment to defend ‚ÄòSwaraj‚Äô: Amit Shah
content: Speaking after the unveiling of an equestrian statue of Maratha statesman and general Peshwa Bajirao I at the National Defence Academy (NDA) in Pune, the BJP leader also said whenever he is plagued by negative thoughts, he thinks of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and Bajirao.

title: How Bhojpuri people migrated to Trinidad in the 1800s
content: Known as Girmitiyas, the ancestors of present day Indo-Trinidadians, were taken to the former British colony as plantation workers.

title: Why are Andhra Pradesh and Telangana fighting over Banakacherla project?
content: Seeking to utilise ‚Äòsurplus‚Äô water flowing into the Bay of Bengal, Andhra Pradesh wishes to link Godavari and Krishna rivers via Banakacherla project and alleviate Rayalseema‚Äôs drought woes.

title: Devanahalli farmers‚Äô protest: CM Siddaramaiah seeks 10 days to clarify government‚Äôs stance on land acquisition
content: Since the final notification was issued in April 2025, the State government has sought time to resolve the legal issues around land acquisition.

title: Five Naga tribes to resume protest against Nagaland‚Äôs job reservation policy on July 9
content: Committee says 48-year-old quota framework outdated; seeks review to reflect present socio-economic realities

title: Supreme Court refuses plea to reconsider NEET-UG results, says lives and careers of students at stake
content: The petition referred to how the provisional answer key had three errors, specifically in questions 52, 136 (Code 47), and 140 (Code 45).

title: TVK will never align with BJP or DMK: Vijay
content: The party also announced that Mr. Vijay would be its chief ministerial candidate for the 2026 Assembly elections

title: Trinamool Congress leader shot at by unidentified miscreants in West Bengal's Coochbehar
content: ‚ÄúRaju Dey suffered injuries in the attack near Jhinaidanga area around 11 p.m. on July 3,‚Äù police said

title: Beyond Bengaluru: A new crop of English writers from border district of Belagavi are keen to make their presence felt
content: Belagavi has historically produced writers in multiple languages ‚Äî Kannada, Marathi, Sanskrit, Konkani, and more. The latest crop of writers are trying their hand at novels, poetry and other forms in English

title: DGCA warned Air India Express about delay on Airbus engine fix, forging records
content: In a statement, Air India Express told Reuters it acknowledged the error to DGCA and undertook "remedial action and preventive measures".

title: Haunted by guilt, Kerala man confesses to ‚Äòaccidentally killing‚Äô harasser¬†nearly four decades ago
content: The man walks into a police station in Malappuram on Friday and calmly confesses to the crime he says he committed as a teenager in 1986. Police have filed a murder case

title: Tiruppur dowry death case: Mother-in-law arrested after Rithanya‚Äôs family alleges slow probe
content: ‚ÄúWe have made an appeal for a comprehensive investigation and expressed concern over the tardy pace of the investigation,‚Äù Annadurai said after meeting the SP.

title: China used India-Pak conflict as ‚Äòlive lab‚Äô, used strategy of killing by ‚Äòborrowed knife‚Äô, says deputy Army Chief Rahul Singh
content: India was actually dealing with three adversaries, he said, suggesting that besides Pakistan and China, Turkiye was also playing a major role in supplying military hardware to Islamabad.

title: Madras High Court warns of CBI probe if T.N. police fail to act against Ponmudy for derogatory speech
content: Justice P. Velmurugan also questions the need for the former Minister to have made such comments, and decides to take a final call on July 8

title: PM Modi, Amit Shah falsely claim more allocation of funds to Tamil Nadu, alleges DMK
content: The DMK‚Äôs Tamil daily said people of Tamil Nadu know ‚Äúpretty well that the BJP-led Union government betrayed Tamil Nadu‚Äù

title: AI 171 crash: Air India refutes allegations of forcing bereaved families to declare financial dependency
content: The controversy surfaced following reports that some of the bereaved families were being compelled to disclose financial ties to their deceased loved ones ‚Äî allegedly as a prerequisite for receiving compensation.

title: Kerala government to form panel for safety audit of decades-old State-funded hospitals
content: Officials say government will work out modalities of building safety audit scheme at a meeting of Ministers and top officials next week

title: 64 MBBS interns suspended at Telangana private medical college for protesting non-payment of stipend
content: The interns agitated alleging that despite a 2023 G.O. mandating a stipend of ‚Çπ25,906 per month for MBBS interns in Telangana, CAIMS has been paying only ‚Çπ2,000 per month

title: T.N police no longer functioning under CM Stalin‚Äôs command, alleges Nainar Nagenthran
content: ‚ÄúThe Police Department appears to be taking orders from some officials in the Secretariat,‚Äù he alleged

title: Kottayam hospital building collapse ignites violent Opposition protests across Kerala
content: Congress, BJP seek to cast the incident as a symbol of governmental mismanagement and disregard towards ordinary people who rely on State-funded hospitals for subsidised medical care

title: ‚ÄúOne Big Beautiful Bill‚Äù: Foreign remittance tax for Indians in U.S.
content: The remittance tax rate was originally set at 5%, but was reduced to 1% in the final version of the Bill

title: No need to re-conduct NEET-UG 2025, affirms Division Bench of Madras High Court
content: The Division Bench confirms a single judge‚Äôs order rejecting the plea for re-examination by candidates who appeared in centres which suffered power disruption

title: Expert panel engaged by Vedanta recommends ‚Äògreen restart‚Äô of Sterlite Copper plant in Thoothukudi
content: The committee proposes the plant can resume operations under stricter environmental regulations and with a more sustainable approach to production

title: Supreme Court refuses to intervene in HDFC Bank CEO‚Äôs plea as Bombay HC lists case on July 14
content: The Bench recorded in its order the multiple instances the case was adjourned in June, and conveyed its ‚Äúhope and trust‚Äù that the High Court would ‚Äútake up‚Äù the matter on July 14.

title: Search for terrorists in J&K‚Äôs Kishtwar enters day 3, cordon strengthened
content: The operation follows an encounter that broke out between the terrorists and the security forces in the heavily forested Kanzal Mandu area of the Kuchal-Chatroo belt

title: Karnataka CM‚Äôs remarks on Covid vaccines ‚Äúfactually incorrect‚Äù says Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, Siddaramaiah hits back
content: Siddaramaiah had suggested that the recent heart attack deaths in Hassan district may be linked to the Covid-19 vaccination drive. He had also claimed the vaccines were ‚Äòhastily‚Äô approved.

title: End peace deals with Kuki armed groups, Manipur organisations tell Centre
content: The organisations representing the Meitei, Naga, and Thadou communities cited repeated violations of the Suspension of Operations agreements and a failure to maintain law and order

title: Supreme Court agrees to examine Tamil Nadu‚Äôs plea against Madras HC stay on nine Acts on V-C appointments in universities
content: The State argued that the High Court had ordered the stay on May 21 despite the Supreme Court, in an April 8 judgment, declaring that the Bills were granted ‚Äòdeemed assent‚Äô  by Governor R.N. Ravi.

title: Nipah virus: Kerala Health department sounds alert in three districts
content: Preventive and control measures will be carried out for the same duration in the three districts, with 26-member committees formed in each district.

title: Govt officials among 34 booked by CBI for manipulation of regulatory framework for medical colleges
content: The syndicate has its roots in the Union Health Ministry, where eight accused officials ran the sophisticated scheme facilitating unauthorised access, illegal duplication and dissemination of highly confidential files and sensitive information to representatives of medical colleges through a network of intermediaries in exchange for huge bribes, the CBI FIR alleged

title: Watch: Police convicted for recent custodial deaths in India: zero | Data Point
content: The Hindu‚Äôs Data team examines whether police personnel are held accountable for custodial deaths ‚Äî and how cases of torture and deaths in custody often go unpunished

title: Shillong hawker eviction drive: Meghalaya High Court appoints special officer to ensure strict adherence to legal procedures
content: The division Bench of Chief Justice I.P. Mukerji and Justice W. Diengdoh appointed senior advocate Subhasis Chakrawarty as the Special Officer

title: 10 detained as protest by Unemployed JAC reaches BRK Bhavan in Hyderabad
content: Police warned students and job aspirants that involvement in such activities could lead to criminal charges that might jeopardise future career prospects

title: Nipah virus resurfaces in Kerala, two cases reported
content: 18-year-old girl who succumbed to acute encephalitis syndrome in Kozhikode and a 38-year-old woman undergoing treatment in Malappuram test positive for Nipah. National Institute of Virology, Pune, confirms Nipah infection in woman. Final result of girl awaited

title: Bodies of people allegedly murdered, raped buried in Dharmasthala village a decade ago; police to probe after man files complaint
content: The complainant who worked as sanitation worker in Dharmasthala from 1995 to 2014 has requested the police to conduct an inquiry by exhuming the remains. He has also offered to show them the places where the bodies were buried.

title: Kottayam medical college hospital incident: Minister Vasavan claims search efforts not delayed
content: Minister says his and Health Minister Veena George's remarks about no one being there in the collapsed structure were based on information provided by hospital authorities, including the medical superintendent

title: Pollachi‚Äôs coir industry eyes global recognition with GI tag application
content: Pollachi, known for its rich tradition in coir manufacturing, boasts over 500 registered manufacturers engaged in coir and related products

title: Kaliganj blast: One more held from Bengal's Palashi, total arrests rise to 10
content: A 13-year-old girl was killed in Molandi village of Kaliganj after bombs were allegedly hurled from a Trinamool Congress victory celebration

title: Puducherry accelerates its fight against TB; ranks number one in IRL for chest diseases
content: ‚ÄúIndia has strengthened its TB response with advanced diagnostics, innovative policies, private sector partnerships, and a patient-first approach,‚Äù said the Union Health Ministry.

title: Stamp papers worth ‚Çπ13.50 lakh stolen from Gannavaram Sub-Registrar Office in A.P.
content: According to an official, non-judicial stamp papers in ‚Çπ50 and ‚Çπ100 denominations and stamps of ‚Çπ50 and ‚Çπ100, kept in the record room of the SRO were missing

title: Raja Raghuvanshi honeymoon murder: Meghalaya court extends judicial custody of three hitmen
content: The three were produced before the court on July 3, via video-conferencing from the Shillong district jail where they have been lodged

title: Thousands take part in Muharram procession in Srinagar
content: This is the third consecutive year that the administration has allowed the Muharram procession to be taken out on the traditional route through the heart of the city

title: Kolkata college gang rape: Police reconstruct crime scene with arrested men
content: The entire reconstruction process, carried out in the presence of a huge police team, lasted for four hours, following which the four were taken back to the police station

title: Amarnath Yatra: 6,400 pilgrims leave Jammu base camp for Kashmir
content: The third batch of 6,411 pilgrims ‚Äî 4,723 men, 1,071 women, 37 children, and 580 sadhus and sadhvis ‚Äî left in 291 vehicles, they said.

title: Holy water from Mahakumbh and replica of Ram Mandir: PM Modi‚Äôs gift to PM of Trinidad & Tobago
content: Modi began his first official visit to Trinidad and Tobago with a ceremonial Guard of Honour at Piarco International Airport, where he was received by Prime Minister Kamla Persad-Bissessar along with 38 ministers and four Members of Parliament of the Caribbean nation.

title: Maharashtra govt orders Mumbai's civic body to immediately shut down 'kabootar khanas'
content: Shiv Sena leader and nominated MLC Manisha Kayande said these ‚Äòkabootar khanas‚Äô pose a danger to the people living around them as their waste and feathers lead to respiratory diseases

title: 11 firearms, war-like stores recovered in Manipur
content: In another operation, a .32 pistol with two empty magazines and two live rounds of .32 mm ammunition were recovered

title: Karnataka rains: Holiday for schools in Shivamogga, Hosanagara taluks
content: The announcement applied to all anganwadi centres, primary schools and high schools, the release said.

title: A castle, built in¬†Hosur¬†by a British Collector, is now a heap of rubble
content: Salem Collector Brett built the castle after the lady who was to be his wife demanded that he build a castle¬†modelled on Kenilworth Castle in Warwickshire. But the district headquarters was shifted to Salem and the couple could not even set foot in the castle

title: A place of pilgrimage in¬†Ariyalur¬†that blends the Tamil culture with faith
content: Adaikala Madha Shrine at¬†Elakurichi was built by Constantine Joseph¬†Beschi in the early 18th Century CE.¬†The wooden statue of Mother Mary at the shrine, believed to have been brought in from Manila and revered not only by Roman Catholics but also by the people of other faiths, is striking for its resemblance to a native Tamil woman

title: Sri Lankan actor-politician who met MGR and Tamil groups on a political mission
content: Vijaya Kumaratunga¬†left the Sri Lanka Freedom Party in January 1984, along with his wife¬†Chandrika, and established the Sri Lanka¬†Mahajana Pakshaya.¬†He visited Madras in June 1986 to find a solution to the bitter problem of Sri Lankan Tamils. Back home, he was vilified by some elements. He was shot dead in Colombo on February 16, 1988

title: Vizag‚Äôs fight against rising homeless population
content: Visakhapatnam is witnessing a rise in homeless population, with its limited number of night shelters bursting at the seams. With just 350 beds across all the eight shelters, far from the Supreme Court mandated number, and few government-run old age homes, the city is struggling to sustain its fight against the crisis, writes Harish Gilai

title: Row over electoral roll revision: CEC says exercise will ensure all eligible citizens are included
content: He also said the revision being undertaken after a gap of 22 years is running as per schedule with the active participation of all political parties

title: Bride, betrayal and bloodshed in Telangana
content: A chilling case from Telangana has laid bare a disturbing pattern unfolding across the country ‚Äî of newlywed grooms being murdered in cold blood, often by their wives in collusion with their paramours. In Gadwal, a 30-year-old youth vanished weeks after his wedding, while his bride wept and prayed for his return. But behind the tears was a calculated plot.¬†Lavpreet Kaur¬†tracks the tragedy

title: Andhra Pradesh‚Äôs coral presence along Visakhapatnam coast recognized in scientific journal
content: Scientific journal documents Visakhapatnam‚Äôs coral reefs in a research study done by Zoological Survey of India¬†

title: Rain alert persists for a few Western Ghats districts this week
content: RMC has issued a yellow weather alert for the Ghat areas of Coimbatore and the Nilgiris districts till tomorrow; Chennai may get evening showers today

title: Supreme Court collegium clears 36 names for appointment as judges in various State High Courts
content: The collegium also approved a proposal for the appointment of 10 judicial officers as judges of the Punjab and Haryana High Court

title: Bengaluru‚Äôs upcoming aerotropolis promises to be a smart, sustainable city
content: A futuristic Bengaluru Airport City will be developed on the KIA premises over the next decade. Spread over 463 acres, it will have business parks, a global innovation hub, an education and health district, a retail dining entertainment village, a concert arena, and more. The Hindu gets an exclusive peek into what the future holds.

title: L-G is interfering in functioning of J&K‚Äôs Information Dept., delaying ‚ÄòBusiness Rules‚Äô, says NC‚Äôs Tanvir Sadiq
content: There has been persistent friction between the Raj Bhavan and the J&K government ever since an elected government took over the reins of the Union Territory in October 2024

title: Contractual employees are entitled to maternity leave, reiterates Orissa High Court
content: ‚ÄòWomen employees, for the purpose of availing such benefit, do constitute one homogenous class, and their artificial bifurcation founded on status of appointment falls foul of Article 14 of the Constitution,‚Äô the Division Bench ruled

title: Indian community‚Äôs journey in Trinidad and Tobago a courageous one: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Persad-Bissessar, who addressed the community before Mr. Modi, said that the Indian leader will be conferred on Friday (July 4, 2025) with ‚ÄòThe Order of Trinidad and Tobago‚Äô, the Caribbean nation‚Äôs highest honour

title: Odisha BJP leader arrested over assault on govt. officer; civil servants return to work
content: Additional Commissioner of the Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation was dragged out of his office and assaulted on June 30; videos of the incident went viral, sparking outrage, mass protest by civil servants that severely affected the functioning of State government offices

title: Gujarat HC grants Asaram Bapu his ‚Äòfinal‚Äô bail extension
content: The Division Bench of Justices Ilesh Vora and PM Raval rejected Asaram‚Äôs lawyer‚Äôs request for a three-month extension, granting only 30 additional days. This follows the court‚Äôs previous interim extension from June 30 to July 7.

title: Kolhapuri chappal row: Ground beneath their feet
content: The 800-year-old, ‚Çπ1,400 crore Kolhapuri chappal industry employs close to 1 lakh artisans, and is spread across four districts each of Maharashtra and Karnataka. Vinaya Deshpande Pandit¬†explores the trade and the tradition of this all-leather, nature-derived, hand-stitched footwear, which has been GI tagged. The craft lacks policy impetus, often leading to its misappropriation, the exploitation of its already-marginalised¬†kaarigars,¬†and an erasure of culture

title: Centre on the defensive over Congress‚Äôs accusations of ‚Äòsubverting‚Äô Forest Act
content: Allegations of subverting forest rights act reflects gross misunderstanding of facts: Environment Ministry¬†

title: Chief Minister inaugurates 208 urban health and wellness centres, 60 PHCs across Tamil Nadu

title: Kidnapped boy found dead inside forest in Krishnagiri district

title: Sivaganga custodial death: autopsy of victim reveals 44 external injuries
